TITLE: Are we in a recession? It doesn’t matter, Fed official says: ‘I’m focused on the inflation data’
SUMMARY: Neel Kashkari, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis, told CBS' "Face the Nation" that inflation poses a larger threat than a potential recession.

TITLE: Home prices cooled at a record pace in June, according to housing data firm
SUMMARY: Home price gains are cooling fast, as demand wanes and still-tight supply builds.

TITLE: Fed's Daly says 'our work is far from done' on inflation; Evans sees 'reasonable' chance for smaller hike
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve still has a lot of work to do before it gets inflation under control, San Francisco Fed President Mary Daly said Tuesday.

TITLE: Household debt tops $16 trillion for the first time, fueled by higher inflation and interest rates
SUMMARY: Household debt climbed past $16 trillion in the second quarter, as soaring inflation pushed up housing and auto balances.

TITLE: Job openings fell sharply in June as labor market shows signs of slowing
SUMMARY: Job openings plunged in June to their lowest level since September 2021 in a potential sign that a historically tight labor market is starting to loosen.

TITLE: These charts show why we may not be in a recession
SUMMARY: If the U.S. economy is in recession, someone forgot to tell the jobs market.

TITLE: The confusing job market: Tech and finance brace for the worst, retail is mixed, travel can't hire fast enough
SUMMARY: The economy has shifted so abruptly in 2022 that most of the big employment trends from the Covid era have reversed, creating major challenges for employers.

TITLE: Fed's Bullard sees more interest rate hikes ahead and no U.S. recession
SUMMARY: St. Louis Fed President James Bullard said the central bank will continue raising rates until it sees compelling evidence that inflation is falling.

TITLE: 4.2 million people quit in June despite recession worries: 'A paradox in our economy'
SUMMARY: The job market continued to post strong numbers in June despite growing concerns about an economic recession.

TITLE: The great unrest: How 2020 changed the economy in ways we can't understand yet
SUMMARY: Because of the Covid pandemic, 2020 was an epoch-changing year. Much like the 9/11 terrorist attacks in 2001, the full effects won't be understood for years.

TITLE: Weekly jobless claims rise to 260,000 ahead of nonfarm payrolls report
SUMMARY: Initial claims for unemployment insurance were expected to total 260,000 for the week ended July 30, according to Dow Jones estimates.

TITLE: Are we in a recession? Here are both sides of the argument and why it's even a debate
SUMMARY: Are we in a recession or are not? If not, is one on the way? CNBC's Emily Lorsch breaks down both sides of the argument and why it's debatable.

TITLE: Despite a strong jobs report, unemployment inched higher for Black workers in July
SUMMARY: Black workers saw a rise in unemployment last month even as the headline number declined.

TITLE: Here's where the jobs are for July 2022 — in one chart
SUMMARY: There was an appetite for workers particularly in the service sector, which has been grappling with labor shortages.

TITLE: Payrolls increased 528,000 in July, much better than expected in a sign of strength for jobs market
SUMMARY: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to increase 258,000 in July, according to Dow Jones estimates.

TITLE: Is the economy in a recession? ‘What you call it is less relevant,’ says one economist: Here’s ‘what really matters'
SUMMARY: Are we in a recession? A former chief economist at the U.S. Department of Labor and a former chair of the White House Council of Economic Advisers weigh in.

TITLE: The price of a pint is going through the roof. Here’s why UK beer costs are far outpacing inflation
SUMMARY: The average cost of a pint of beer in the U.K. has soared by 70% since 2008 — well ahead of inflation.

TITLE: Fed Governor Bowman sees 'similarly sized' rate hikes ahead after three-quarter point moves
SUMMARY: Federal Reserve Governor Michelle Bowman said Saturday she supports the central bank's recent big rate increases and believes they should continue.

TITLE: Danger ahead: The U.S. economy has yet to face its biggest recession challenge
SUMMARY: You'd be hard-pressed now to find a recession in the rearview mirror. What's down the road, though, is another story.
